bug.short_desc: No lint check for try-finally without catch is required

long_desc.thetext: Well, since #3688 defines the bug for IE <= 7 and they no longer supported in qx3+, I think, lint job should not be warning about "A finally clause without a catch might not be run (bug#3688)".

(In reply to comment #0) > Well, since #3688 defines the bug for IE <= 7 and they no longer supported in > qx3+, I think, lint job should not be warning about "A finally clause without a > catch might not be run (bug#3688)".
qx.Website still supports IE6 & IE7 so we can't remove it by now. :( But maybe we can disable it in the mobile / desktop skeletons?

Oops, I was working on a desktop app based on 3.0.1, so the remained old IE support completely fell out of my sight. I guess there're two ways. If it's easy to separate by application type in generator code, then warnings could be kept for website and native only. If it doesn't fit the design, we can wait keeping the bug open until qooxdoo 4.0 ;-)
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 8446 ***
